t: Psalm 89
I Will Sing of the Steadfast Love of the Lord
A Maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
I*pn will sing of the steadfast love of the Lord,*s forever; with*ld my mouth I will make known your faithfulness to all generations.
For*ln I said, “Steadfast love will be built up forever; in*ld the heavens you will establish your faithfulness.”
You*ln have said, “I have made a covenant with my chosen one; I*ld have sworn to David my servant:
‘I*ln will establish your offspring forever, and*ld build your throne for all generations.’” Selah*ig
Let*pn the heavens praise your wonders, O Lord,*s your*ld faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones!
For*ln who in the skies can be compared to the Lord?*s Who*ld among the heavenly beings is like the Lord,*s
a*ln God greatly to be feared in the council of the holy ones, and*ld awesome above all who are around him?
O*ln Lord*s God of hosts, who*ld is mighty as you are, O Lord,*s with*ld your faithfulness all around you?
You*ln rule the raging of the sea; when*ld its waves rise, you still them.
You*ln crushed Rahab like a carcass; you*ld scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.
The*ln heavens are yours; the earth also is yours; the*ld world and all that is in it, you have founded them.
The*ln north and the south, you have created them; Tabor*ld and Hermon joyously praise your name.
You*ln have a mighty arm; strong*ld is your hand, high your right hand.
Righteousness*ln and justice are the foundation of your throne; steadfast*ld love and faithfulness go before you.
Blessed*ln are the people who know the festal shout, who*ld walk, O Lord,*s in the light of your face,
who*ln exult in your name all the day and*ld in your righteousness are exalted.
For*ln you are the glory of their strength; by*ld your favor our horn is exalted.
For*ln our shield belongs to the Lord,*s our*ld king to the Holy One of Israel.
Of*pn old you spoke in a vision to your godly one, and said: “I*ld have granted help to one who is mighty; I*ld have exalted one chosen from the people.
I*ln have found David, my servant; with*ld my holy oil I have anointed him,
so*ln that my hand shall be established with him; my*ld arm also shall strengthen him.
The*ln enemy shall not outwit him; the*ld wicked shall not humble him.
I*ln will crush his foes before him and*ld strike down those who hate him.
My*ln faithfulness and my steadfast love shall be with him, and*ld in my name shall his horn be exalted.
I*ln will set his hand on the sea and*ld his right hand on the rivers.
He*ln shall cry to me, ‘You are my Father, my*ld God, and the Rock of my salvation.’
And*ln I will make him the firstborn, the*ld highest of the kings of the earth.
My*ln steadfast love I will keep for him forever, and*ld my covenant will stand firm for him.
I*ln will establish his offspring forever and*ld his throne as the days of the heavens.
If*ln his children forsake my law and*ld do not walk according to my rules,
if*ln they violate my statutes and*ld do not keep my commandments,
then*ln I will punish their transgression with the rod and*ld their iniquity with stripes,
but*ln I will not remove from him my steadfast love or*ld be false to my faithfulness.
I*ln will not violate my covenant or*ld alter the word that went forth from my lips.
Once*ln for all I have sworn by my holiness; I*ld will not lie to David.
His*ln offspring shall endure forever, his*ld throne as long as the sun before me.
Like*ln the moon it shall be established forever, a*ld faithful witness in the skies.” Selah*ig
But*pn now you have cast off and rejected; you*ld are full of wrath against your anointed.
You*ln have renounced the covenant with your servant; you*ld have defiled his crown in the dust.
You*ln have breached all his walls; you*ld have laid his strongholds in ruins.
All*ln who pass by plunder him; he*ld has become the scorn of his neighbors.
You*ln have exalted the right hand of his foes; you*ld have made all his enemies rejoice.
You*ln have also turned back the edge of his sword, and*ld you have not made him stand in battle.
You*ln have made his splendor to cease and*ld cast his throne to the ground.
You*ln have cut short the days of his youth; you*ld have covered him with shame. Selah*ig
How*pn long, O Lord?*s Will you hide yourself forever? How*ld long will your wrath burn like fire?
Remember*ln how short my time is! For*ld what vanity you have created all the children of man!
What*ln man can live and never see death? Who*ld can deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah*ig
Lord,*pn where is your steadfast love of old, which*ld by your faithfulness you swore to David?
Remember,*ln O Lord, how your servants are mocked, and*ld how I bear in my heart the insults of all the many nations,
with*ln which your enemies mock, O Lord,*s with*ld which they mock the footsteps of your anointed.
Blessed*pn be the Lord*s forever! Amen*l and Amen.
